result.execSummary:
The defendant Grace S Badalik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Apply 3 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to Court costs, DNA surcharge and Buy money.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Buy money to be paid joint/several with co-actor.  To be paid to METRO Drug Unit.

No use or possession of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with the co-actor listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Grace S Badalik in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD. 
3 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.

Term of Probation:  18 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with:  Co-Actor listed in the criminal compliant.
DNA sample to be provided.

Buy Money:  $300 Joint/several with co-actor (to be paid to METRO Drug Unit - to be paid before costs/fines).
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Sentencing hearing on November 22, 2016 at 10:00 am.
